conversation.aPrompt: What services are offered to Ukrainian citizens through employment agencies?
conversation.bResponse: Ukrainian citizens who come from the conflict zone can register at employment agencies where they will receive assistance in finding a job regardless of their qualifications or experience documentation. They can also access free counseling and professional information services during this process. Following the registration, individuals must fill out a self-declaration form, which is crucial when signing the employment contract. This service is available for those seeking jobs and willing to take part in interviews or work tests conducted by the agency. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania
conversation.cSubject: How can Ukrainian citizens who come from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine work in Romania

conversation.aPrompt: How does the process of registering and finding a job work for Ukrainian citizens?
conversation.bResponse: Ukrainian citizens who come from the conflict zone can register at employment agencies to find a job. They need to provide an identity document for registration. Afterwards, they can receive counselling and professional information services for free. During this process, individuals must fill out a statement based on their own responsibility with the assistance of a counselor. This helps them find a suitable job, attend interviews, and take part in work tests. If they find an employer directly, they may complete the statement together with the employer.
